title: [Large-Scale] Blended Instructional Design to Address Gender Gaps in Computational Thinking Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and logical reasoning skills
context.additional_context: Computing thinking education linked to social studies conducted in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain computational thinking concepts with over 85% engagement through unplugged activities.
Maintain a Gender Disparity Index (GDI) of 0.8 or higher in programming tasks applying a blended approach.
Achieve a performance level of 3.2 or higher on a 4-point self-efficacy scale for female learners during plugged learning.
Reduce the gap between CT concept understanding and practical problem-solving skills to within 15% in formative assessments.

resources: Offline Activity Kit (Board Games, Puzzles, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
